comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Is that the steam launch 'Ena'? -

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: This [imho hideous!] building was "The Landing Pavilion". Full details of the Royal visit in the SMH of 28/5/1901 page 5 onwards, including illustration of this building. Read all about it - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14387721

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: Certainly not a 'rotunda'. I agree with beachcomber! Hideous - but tastes change!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Thanks folks, we'll update the caption.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: BobMeade [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy/] knows all about the history of this "extraordinary" pavilion. See this 2009 entry on his blog here - lifeasdaddy.typepad.com/lifeasdaddy/2009/09/commonground-... - including a brilliant double-photo from the National Library of the ceremony itself.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Ha! I thought it rang a bell. The Pavillion looked even worse in Ashfield - like a drag queen's loo roll dispenser! - [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2963821918/] I am confused by all the celebrations and which photo belongs to which - Lord Hopetoun's arrival as Governor General in Dec 1900 ( trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14353984 ), Federation in January 1901, and the Royal visit in May 1901.

comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: Take your pick, maybe the NSW Government showed incredible foresight (!) and built one pavilion for all three celebrations! If so can we please have that government back on 26 March, please?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Here's to the link to Bob Meade's [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] post on what happened to the Pavilion after life at Farm Cove. AB
